meanings.definition: A cord or strap worn around the neck to hold a whistle or knife.
meanings.sent1: The scout always kept his whistle on a laniard for easy access.
meanings.sent2: She wore a laniard with her knife while hiking in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The laniard and whistle went on a little adventure of their own.
meanings.sent4: His laniard of memories held the key to his past.
meanings.sent5: The bright red laniard stood out against his dark jacket.

meanings.definition: A cord with a hook at one end, used to fire a cannon.
meanings.sent1: The sailor quickly grabbed the laniard to fire the cannon.
meanings.sent2: They pulled the laniard to release the cannonball.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull tried to steal the laniard for a swing.
meanings.sent4: The laniard of fate was about to be pulled, changing everything.
meanings.sent5: With a swift pull of the laniard, the cannon roared to life.
